info.info.intro: This is a tool created by Shah Khalid (e-pool Pharmacy Coordinator, OCG). It supports structured management of kits, modules, items, stock transactions, reporting, and multilingual operation for preparedness and deployment workflows.
info.info.overview:
The application (IsEPREP) manages:
- Users and Roles (admin, manager, hq, etc.)
- Project details (project name/code) ‚Äì required before full functionality
- Scenarios (top-level contextual grouping)
- Standard item list and families
- Kit and Module composition (structural vs instance layer)
- Stock IN / OUT movements (including to/from Kits/Modules)
- Receiving & Dispatching Kits (with kit_number / module_number instance tracking)
- Inventory adjustments (stock_inv / InventoryKit)
- Reports framework (Stock Statement, Expiry, Availability, Consumption, Loans, Donations, Losses, Order/Needs ‚Äì some may still be ‚Äúunder construction‚Äù)
- Dynamic reporting views (SQL views built in reports_backend.py)
- Export to Excel (current report view)
- Multilingual UI (English, French, Spanish) via language_manager
- Accessibility improvements for data entry (highlighted entries, improved spacing)
- Expiry awareness (items with remarks containing 'exp')
- Future capacity for coverage (required vs current) and kit completeness metrics.
info.info.data_model:
Core tables expected:
- users (username, password_hash, role)
- project_details (project metadata)
- items_list (code, designations, remarks -> triggers expiry requirement)
- kit_items (scenario_id, kit, module, item, std_qty, level)
- stock_transactions (Date, Time, unique_id, code, Qty_IN, Qty_Out, Types, Third_Party, End_User, Expiry_date, Remarks, Movement_Type, Kit, Module, Scenario)
- stock_data (current accumulated lines: unique_id, code, qty_in, qty_out, exp_date, kit_number, module_number)
- additional tables: third parties, end users, etc.
info.info.unique_id: unique_id encodes hierarchical path (Scenario/Kit/Module/Item...). It enables parsing scenario_id (substring before first '/') and ensuring traceability down to kit/module instances.
info.info.kit_module_popups:
- select_kit_popup: prompts for selecting structural kit code & entering a unique kit_number (enforces uniqueness per scenario).
- select_module_popup: similar for module_number, with validation (either scenario+kit uniqueness or global uniqueness depending on version).
- Accessible entry wrappers (from popup_utils) can emphasize focus and show error borders.
- Validation ensures no duplicates within chosen scope.
info.info.receive_dispatch:
- Stock In / Out write to stock_transactions (Qty_IN or Qty_Out).
- Kit or Module specific adds use Add to Kit/Module or Remove from Kit/Module (in_kit / out_kit).
- Receiving Kits: Create new kit_number and related module_number(s).
- Dispatch Kits: Track outbound movement or allocation.
- Inventory Adjustments (StockInventory or InventoryKit) handle corrections (In Correction of Previous Transaction).
info.info.reports_system:
The reports_backend.py builds the views:
- vw_report_detailed (raw transactions with unified direction, quantity)
- vw_report_summary (aggregated by date/code)
- vw_report_expiry (expiring items, expiry bucket classification: EXPIRED, ALERT_30/60/90, OK)
- vw_report_required_qty (required vs current coverage % from kit_items vs stock_data)

Reports UI (reports.py):
- Modes: detailed, summary, expiry, required_qty
- Filters: search term (code/description), date range, direction (IN/OUT), sorting
- Export to Excel: Writes Treeview columns and rows to .xlsx using openpyxl.
info.info.placeholder_reports:
- Stock Expiry (dedicated view can later refine expiry pivot)
- Stock Availability (future: show available vs allocated vs reserved)
- Consumption (will require Out transaction semantics)
- Loans (filter IN_Type or Movement_Type for loaned/returned)
- Donations (IN_Type = Donation / In Donation)
- Losses (Out or negative adjustments or remarks)
- Order/Needs (gap analysis based on required vs current coverage_pct)
info.info.language:
- lang.t(key, fallback="...") is used extensively. Ensure added keys for new menus (menu.reports.* and generic.under_construction).
- You can add more languages by extending language_manager configuration & JSON mapping files.
info.info.user_roles:
- Certain menu entries only enabled if role in ["admin", "manager"] and project configured.
- Project details required early; failing that prompts user to create/review project.
info.info.workflow:
1. Log in (choose language).
2. Set up Project (if missing).
3. Create or import Items & Families.
4. Define Scenarios.
5. Build Kit + Module composition (kit_items table via Kits Composition).
6. Receive initial stock (Stock In / Receive Kit).
7. Assign kit_number/module_number as needed, respecting uniqueness.
8. Use Stock Statement (Reports) for verification.
9. Use Expiry and Required Qty (once populated) to manage replenishment and rotation.
10. Export periodic Excel snapshots for audit / external sharing.
info.info.data_integrity:
- Keep unique_id generation consistent (avoid accidental double slashes).
- Always validate kit_number/module_number uniqueness to avoid merging flows.
- Consider indexing high-frequency columns (code, Date, Scenario) for large DB performance.
info.info.future_enhancements:
- Row coloring on expiry buckets.
- Coverage progress bars per item.
- Charting dashboard (matplotlib / ttkbootstrap).
- Role-based granular permissions (view vs edit).
- Batch imports (CSV) with validation preview.
- Audit log of user actions.
info.info.tips:
- Press Enter in popups to confirm entries quickly.
- Escape closes most popups.
- Use search box in Reports to quickly narrow results by partial code or description.
- Use date filters to limit heavy result sets for performance.
- If formatting issues occur (spacing), confirm your VS Code formatting settings (disable format-on-paste if interfering).
info.info.support:
If you encounter missing views, ensure initialize_reporting (reports_backend.initialize_reporting) ran before opening Reports. For schema changes, drop views and re-run initialization.

Enjoy using the system to keep preparedness logistics structured and traceable.
info.receive_kit.title: Receive Kit-Module
info.receive_kit.expiry_prompt_message: Enter expiry (YYYY-MM-DD, DD/MM/YYYY, MM/YYYY, etc.) for {code} - {desc}:

info.receive_kit.invalid_quantity_msg: Quantity must be a whole number
info.receive_kit.kit_module_quantity_info: Quantity for Kit or Module must always remain 1.
info.receive_kit.manual_intro: User Manual for Receive Kit-Module Page
info.receive_kit.manual_overview: This page allows you to receive and manage kits, modules, and items in your inventory system. It's designed for simple use, even if you're new to computers.
info.receive_kit.manual_section1_content:
1. Select Scenario: Choose the project or location from the dropdown.
2. Select Movement Type: Pick how you're adding items (e.g., Receive Kit).
3. Use selectors for Kit or Module if needed.
info.receive_kit.manual_section2_content: Search for items in the box. Select from the list to add. Edit quantity, expiry, or batch in the table.
info.receive_kit.manual_section3_content: Enter expiry dates manually. The system shows group earliest but doesn't auto-adopt. Comments indicate if adopted.
info.receive_kit.manual_section4_content: Click Save to store data. Export to Excel for records.
info.title: Application Information
info.author: Author: Shah Khalid (e-pool Pharmacy Coordinator, OCG)
info.purpose: Purpose: Structured preparedness & deployment logistics (kits, modules, stock, reporting) with multilingual UI.
info.intro_text:
IsEPREP helps humanitarian / medical operations manage:
- Item master data (multi-language designations)
- Kit & Module structural composition
- Scenario-based planning (up to 15)
- Stock movements (IN / OUT / Kit receive / Kit dispatch / adjustments)
- Tracking of kit_number and module_number instances
- Visibility via consolidated reports (expiry risk, availability, consumption preparation)
- Role & language aware UI (EN, FR, ES)
Goal: Consistent, auditable, scalable data to support readiness & rapid deployment.
info.concepts_text:
1. ITEM: Base supply element (medicine / device / logistic component).
2. MODULE: Logical grouping of Items (e.g. Dressing Module).
3. KIT: Higher-level grouping (e.g. Trauma Kit) composed of MODULES and standalone ITEMS.
4. SCENARIO: Contextual operational environment (e.g. Cholera Outbreak, Field Hospital).
5. COMPOSITION LAYERS:
   - STRUCTURAL: Kit -> Module -> Item blueprint (no quantities in stock yet).
   - INSTANCE / STOCK: Real physical stock with transaction history and expiry.
6. UNIQUE IDENTIFIERS:
   - code: Item code or Kit/Module structural code.
   - treecode: 11-digit hierarchical code (SS PPP MMM III).
   - unique_id / unique_id_2: Encodes scenario and path for traceability.
7. ROLES: admin (@), hq (&), coordinator ((, manager (~), supervisor ($)
8. MULTI-LINGUAL: designation_en / designation_fr / designation_sp prioritized by user language.
info.workflow_text:
1. LOGIN & LANGUAGE ‚Üí Choose interface language.
2. PROJECT SETUP ‚Üí Enter Project Details (name/code) if missing.
3. MASTER DATA ‚Üí Import or add Items & Item Families.
4. SCENARIOS ‚Üí Define scenario contexts (max 15).
5. KIT / MODULE COMPOSITION ‚Üí Build structural relationships.
6. STANDARD LIST ‚Üí View quantities per scenario; adjust planning.
7. STOCK RECEIPT ‚Üí Record initial inbound stock.
8. KIT/MODULE INSTANCE ‚Üí Assign kit_number/module_number.
9. STOCK OUT / DISPATCH ‚Üí Track consumption or deployment.
10. ADJUSTMENTS ‚Üí Inventory corrections.
11. REPORTING ‚Üí Use Statement / Expiry / Availability reports.
12. EXPORT & ARCHIVE ‚Üí Generate Excel snapshots; perform backups.
info.data_model_text: users, project_details, items_list, kit_items, compositions, stock_transactions, stock_data, third_parties, end_users, item_families, views (vw_report_detailed, vw_report_summary, vw_report_expiry, vw_report_required_qty)
info.security_text:
- Password hashing: PBKDF2 (salted).
- Backups: Use encrypted ZIP (recommended).
- Avoid manual DB edits; use application flows.
- For large deployments: Consider adding indexes.
info.reports_text:
1. Stock Statement ‚Üí Transaction-level detail.
2. Stock Summary ‚Üí Aggregated per code.
3. Expiry ‚Üí Buckets: EXPIRED, ALERT_30, ALERT_60, ALERT_90, OK.
4. Required Qty ‚Üí Planned vs current coverage.
5. Availability ‚Üí Net available / allocated (planned).
6. Consumption ‚Üí Outflow analytics (planned).
7. Donations / Loans / Losses ‚Üí Based on movement_type.
8. Order / Needs ‚Üí Gap analysis.
info.troubleshooting_text:
Q: Items not appearing in Kits Composition search?
A: Ensure type field matches and correct language designation.

Q: Scenario columns missing in Standard List?
A: Confirm scenarios exist and not exceeding 15; reload screen.

Q: Report empty?
A: Verify stock_transactions inserted. Perform Stock In first.

Q: Duplicated kit_number errors?
A: Numbers must be unique within scenario; adjust naming.

Q: Can't edit (greyed out)?
A: Role is restricted; escalate to admin.
info.quick_start_text:
1. Add Items.
2. Add Scenarios.
3. Build Kit/Module structure.
4. Set scenario quantities (Standard List).
5. Receive stock (Stock In).
6. Assign kit instances (Receive Kit).
7. Dispatch / Outflow (Dispatch Kit / Stock Out).
8. Monitor Expiry & Statement Reports.
9. Export & Backup regularly.
info.support_text:
If a report view is missing:
- Rerun reporting initialization routine.
- Check schema migrations / PRAGMA statements.

For structural anomalies:
- Validate no duplicate treecodes (rebuild if necessary).
- Export current kit_items before manual intervention.

Enjoy using IsEPREP to streamline preparedness logistics!

stock_issue.title: Stock Issue
stock_issue.invalid_quantity_msg: Quantity must be a whole number
stock_issue.perm_error_msg: Only admin or manager can save.
stock_issue.manual_intro: User Manual for Stock Issue Page
stock_issue.manual_overview: This page allows you to issue and manage items in your inventory system. It's designed for simple use, even if you're new to computers.
stock_issue.manual_section1_content:
1. Select Scenario: Choose the project or location from the dropdown.
2. Select OUT Type: Pick how you're issuing items (e.g., Out to End User).
3. Use selectors for End User or Third Party if needed.
stock_issue.manual_section2_content: Search for items in the box. Select from the list to add. Edit quantity or remarks in the table.
stock_issue.manual_section3_content: Click Save to store data. Export to Excel for records.
stock_issue.manual_section4_content:
- Ensure you have the right permissions (admin or manager) to save changes.
- Use the search box to quickly find items by code or description.
- Clear filters to reset your selections and start fresh.
stock_issue.manual_section5_content: If you encounter any issues or need assistance, please contact your system administrator or refer to the support documentation provided with the application.
